title: ReferenceSpecimen
description:
A reference specimen is a specimen with known or accepted values of some property.  The citation property describes the location of a published description of these values. Reference specimens include analytical blanks. <font color="#4f81bd">ReferenceSpecimens</font> are used in quality control procedures to assess method reproducibility. 

Analytical results from a reference specimen analysed during an <font color="#4f81bd">AnalyticalSession</font> are delivered in the same way as the results of other specimens analysed in that session.

referenceDescription.title: referenceDescription
referenceDescription.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">referenceDescription</font> is an association between a <font color="#4f81bd">ReferenceSpecimen</font> and a <font color="#4f81bd">CIT:CI_Citation</font> that references a citation of published analytical results for this standard reference specimen.

usedIn-1.title: usedIn
usedIn-1.description: The property usedIn is an association between a ReferenceSpecimen and an AnalyticalSession in which the reference specimen was used.

usedIn-2.title: usedIn
usedIn-2.description: The property usedIn is an association between a ReferenceSpecimen and an AnalyticalSession in which the reference specimen was used.

usedIn-3.title: usedIn
usedIn-3.description: The property usedIn is an association between a ReferenceSpecimen and an AnalyticalSession in which the reference specimen was used.
